title: How to Use the ESP32 Web Flasher
description: Learn how to flash firmware to your ESP32 or ESP8266 directly from your browser using the built-in flasher tool.
author: sddionOS Dev

contentBlocks.text: Welcome! If you've ever wanted to put new software (firmware) on your ESP32 or ESP8266 chip but found it too complicated, you're in the right place. Our **ESP32 Web Flasher** makes it as easy as browsing a website.

### What do you need?
Before we start, make sure you have these simple things ready:

contentBlocks.title: Plug it in
contentBlocks.text: Connect your chip to your computer using the USB cable. On your sddionOS desktop, look for the **ESP Flasher** app and click to open it.

contentBlocks.title: Choosing the Right Speed
contentBlocks.text: In the app, you'll see a setting called **Baud Rate**. Think of this as the 'talking speed' between your computer and the chip.

contentBlocks.title: Pro Tip
contentBlocks.text: 115200 is the standard speed and works for almost everyone. Keep it at that unless you're an expert!

contentBlocks.title: Connecting via the Browser
contentBlocks.text:
Click the big **Connect Device** button. A small window will pop up at the top of your browser. 

- Look for something labeled **'USB Serial Port'**, **'CP210x'**, or **'CH340'**.
- Click on it, then click **Connect**.
If you see a green 'Connected' message, you're doing great!

contentBlocks.title: Loading your Software
contentBlocks.text:
Now, click on the **Upload Area** (the box with the cloud icon). Choose your `.bin` file from your computer.

Most software starts at 'Address' `0x10000` or `0x0`. Check your firmware's documentation if unsure.

contentBlocks.title: The Magic Part - Flashing!
contentBlocks.text: Click the **Begin Flash Cycle** button. You'll see some text scrolling at the bottomâ€”that's just the computer talking to the chip.

contentBlocks.code:
Connecting... OK
Erasing flash... OK
Writing at 0x00010000... (10%)
Writing at 0x00012000... (20%)
...
Flash Completed Successfully!
Hard resetting via RTS pin...

contentBlocks.title: Stuck?
contentBlocks.text: If it fails to connect, try holding the **BOOT** button on your ESP32 while clicking connect. Some boards need this to enter programming mode.
